titleStmt.title: To the right honourable the Lords and Commons now in Parliament assembled the humble petition of the knights, gentry, ministers, and freeholders, of the county of Yorke, now net at the assizes there holden. Humble petition of the knights, gentry, ministers, and freeholders, of the county of Yorke, now net at the assizes there holden

To the right honourable the Lords and Commons now in Parliament assembled the humble petition of the knights, gentry, ministers, and freeholders, of the county of Yorke, now net at the assizes there holden. Humble petition of the knights, gentry, ministers, and freeholders, of the county of Yorke, now net at the assizes there holden

publicationStmt.publisher: by E.P. for Iohn Wright, dwelling in the Old-baily,

notesStmt.note: Ordered to be printed: Martis 12 Aprilis 1642. By Jo. Browne Cler. Parliamentor.

Having petitioned the King to come to terms with Parliament and received his answer, which we send you, we pray you to take such steps for reconciliation as are consistent with the aims of the protestation. -- Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
